title: Deposits made by depository financial services loan
context: ยง412:9-410 Deposits made by depository financial services loan companies. A depository financial services loan company may deposit any of its funds with: (1) A Federal Reserve Bank or a Federal Home Loan Bank in any amount; or (2) Another depository institution; provided that the deposits in any one depository institution do not exceed twenty-five per cent of the depository financial services loan company&rsquo;s capital and surplus, unless otherwise permitted by federal law. [L 1993, c 350, pt of ยง1; am L 1994, c 107, ยง17]
